metadata.dc:author: Tajadura, F
Rodríguez, P
Pérez, C
Torroba, L
Mendoza, H
metadata.dc:description: A 32-year old man without immunodepression developed sinusitis followed by acute pyogenic meningitis and beta-hemolytic Streptococcus group F bacteremia. Amplicillin treatment produced a favorable outcome with sequela of righ neurosensorial deafness. Beta-hemolytic Streptococcus group F meningitis, sinusitis and bacteremia is a rare association.
metadata.dc:title: Sinusitis, bacteriemia y meningitis aguda por Streptococcus betahemolítico del grupo F.
[Acute sinusitis, bacteremia and meningitis caused by group F beta-hemolytic Streptococcus].
